maml:description.maml:para: Checks for the condition(s) and stops the pipeline with a message if any condition is false or not Boolean.
If the assertion fails then a message is shown and the PipelineStoppedException exception is thrown after that. A running macro, if any, is stopped before showing the message.
If the message Title is provided then just a simple message is shown on failures, all the assertion details are omitted. This mode is suitable for production scripts.
A Boolean value or an array of Boolean values to be checked.
The message to display on failure or a script block to invoke and get the message.
The title of a simple message designed for production scripts.
Checks the current window is dialog.
Checks the current window is editor.
Asserts the current panel file description.
Asserts the current panel file name.
Asserts the current file owner.
Checks the active panel is native (not plugin).
Checks the passive panel is native (not plugin).
Checks the current window is panels.
Checks the active panel is plugin.
Checks the passive panel is plugin.
Checks the current window is viewer.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # User friendly error message. Mind use of -Message and -Title with switches: Assert-Far -Panels -Message "Run this script from panels." -Title "Search-Regex" Assert-Far ($Far.Window.Kind -eq 'Panels') "Run this script from panels." "Search-Regex"

maml:description.maml:para: Finds the specified panel file and sets it current.
If a panel file is not found the cmdlet writes an error.
> Find-FarFile -Name
Find the file by its exact name.
> Find-FarFile -Where [-Up]
Find the file using the Boolean script block.
File name to find.
Boolean script block operating on $_ ~ FarFile.
Tells to search up, not down.
Creates a panel file (custom or from a file system info).
Creates a panel file (custom or from a file system info).
File system info (file or directory).
Sets FarFile.Name
Sets FarFile.Description
Sets FarFile.Attributes
Values : ReadOnly, Hidden, System, Directory, Archive, Device, Normal, Temporary, SparseFile, ReparsePoint, Compressed, Offline, NotContentIndexed, Encrypted
Sets FarFile.Columns
Sets FarFile.CreationTime
Sets FarFile.Data
Tells to use the full name for a file system item.
Sets FarFile.LastAccessTime
Sets FarFile.LastWriteTime
Sets FarFile.Length
Sets FarFile.Owner
Strings used as names of new file objects.
File and directory objects which properties are copied to new file objects.
New file objects.
Creates an item for menus, list menus and list dialog controls.
Creates an item for menus, list menus and list dialog controls.
Sets FarItem.Text
Sets FarItem.Click
Sets FarItem.Checked
Sets FarItem.Data
Sets FarItem.Disabled
Sets FarItem.Grayed
Sets FarItem.Hidden
Sets FarItem.IsSeparator
A new item for menus and lists.
Searches files in the panel and opens the result panel with found items.
Searches files in the panel and opens the result panel with found items.
Classic Far Manager file mask including exclude and regular expression forms.
Search script. Variables: $this is the explorer providing the file, $_ is the file.
Tells to performs the search in the background and to open the result panel immediately.
Search depth. 0: ignored; negative: unlimited.
Tells to include directories into the search process and results.
Tells to search through all directories and sub-directories.
XPath expression file.
XPath expression text.
Shows a message box with one or more choice buttons.
If there are two or more buttons it returns either the selected button index or -1 on escape, otherwise nothing is returned, it is used simply to display a message.
Message text. Text with long lines or many lines is allowed, but some lines may be not shown.
Message caption.
Standard message buttons.
Values : Ok, OkCancel, AbortRetryIgnore, YesNo, YesNoCancel, RetryCancel
User defined choice buttons. On too many choices a message box is converted into a dialog.
Tells to draw the message box with no buttons and continue. The caller has to redraw or restore the screen.
Help topic.
If error type returned by GetLastError is known, the error description will be shown before the message body text.
Warning message colors are used (white text on red background by default).
Do not redraw the message background.
Tells to left align the message lines.
The selected button index or -1 on escape, or none if the message box has no choice buttons and just shows a message.
Starts a new background job (not classic PowerShell job).

It helps to create a background job with available parameters. Note: PowerShellFar background jobs are simple jobs that use PowerShell engine only and oriented for no output or formatted text output. In contrast, standard PowerShell background jobs require WSMan and output objects.
A command name or a script block.
Command parameters. IDictionary for named parameters, IList for arguments, or a single argument.
Started job is not returned, not shown in the list, output is discarded and succeeded job is disposed.
If the job fails or finishes with errors it is included in the list so that errors can be investigated.
For a hidden job parameters Output, Return, and KeepSeconds are ignored.
Tells to keep succeeded job only for specified number of seconds.
Set 0 to remove the succeeded job immediately.
Jobs with errors are not removed automatically, you should remove them from the list.
Stopwatch is started when the first job notification is shown in the console title.
Job friendly name to display.
Tells to start and return the job with exposed Output. Dispose() has to called when the job is done.
Returns not yet started job with exposed Output. StartJob() and Dispose() are called explicitly.
A new not yet started job if the Return switch is used, otherwise nothing is returned.
Gets the current panel file, selected files, or all files.
Gets the current panel file, selected files, or all files.
Tells to get all the panel items.
Tells to get items from the passive panel.
Tells to get selected panel items or the current one if none is selected.
Gets provider items or attached to files data objects from panels.
Gets provider items or attached to files data objects from panels.
Tells to get all the panel items.
Tells to get items from the passive panel.
Tells to get selected panel items or the current one if none is selected.
Gets the current panel path, selected paths, or all paths.
Gets the current panel path, selected paths, or all paths.
Tells to get all the panel items.
Tells to join the target file names with the opposite panel path.
Tells to get items from the passive panel.
Tells to get selected panel items or the current one if none is selected.
Creates an editor for other settings before opening.
Creates an editor for other settings before opening.
The path of a file to be opened.
Line number to open the editor at. The first is 1.
Character number in the line to open the editor at. The first is 1.
Tells when and how to delete the file when closed.
Values : None, File, Folder, UnusedFile, UnusedFolder
Tells to not add the file to the history.
The host instance.
Switching between editor and viewer.
Values : Auto, Enabled, Disabled
Window title. The default is the file path.
Creates and opens an editor.
Creates and opens an editor.
The path of a file to be opened.
Line number to open the editor at. The first is 1.
Character number in the line to open the editor at. The first is 1.
Tells when and how to delete the file when closed.
Values : None, File, Folder, UnusedFile, UnusedFolder
Tells to not add the file to the history.
The host instance.
Tells to open modal. By default it is not but it depends on where it is opened.
Switching between editor and viewer.
Values : Auto, Enabled, Disabled
Window title. The default is the file path.

Creates a viewer for other settings before opening.

Values : Auto, Enabled, Disabled
Window title. The default is the file path.

Values : None, File, Folder, UnusedFile, UnusedFolder
Tells to not add the file to the history.
Tells to open modal. By default it is not but it depends on where it is opened.
Switching between editor and viewer.
Values : Auto, Enabled, Disabled
Window title. The default is the file path.
Opens the panel.
The panel is opened only when the core gets control.
A panel or explorer to be opened or an object which members to be shown.
Tells to open the panel as a child of the current parent.
Attached user data.
Custom data ID to distinguish files by data.
Tells to update data periodically when idle.
Panel sort mode.

Values : Default, Unsorted, Name, Extension, LastWriteTime, CreationTime, LastAccessTime, Length, Description, Owner, CompressedSize, LinkCount, StreamCount, StreamSize, FullName, ChangeTime, ChangeTimeReversed, FullNameReversed, StreamSizeReversed, StreamCountReversed, LinkCountReversed, CompressedSizeReversed, OwnerReversed, DescriptionReversed, LengthReversed, LastAccessTimeReversed, CreationTimeReversed, LastWriteTimeReversed, ExtensionReversed, NameReversed, UnsortedReversed
Panel title.
Panel type ID.
Panel view mode.
Values : AlternativeFull, Brief, Medium, Full, Wide, Detailed, Descriptions, LongDescriptions, FileOwners, FileLinks, Undefined
The panel being opened.
Sends output to a new or appends to the active object panel.
Sends output to a new or appends to the active object panel.
Custom columns (names or special hash tables).
Use property names to specify columns or hash tables to describe columns in details, see [Meta] about hash tables and PanelPlan.Columns about column types.
Tells to append objects to the active object panel. All others options are ignored.
Attached user data.
Custom data ID to distinguish files by data.
Regular expression pattern of members to be excluded in a child list panel.
Regular expression pattern of members to be hidden in a child list panel.
Tells to update data periodically when idle.
Object(s) to be sent to an object panel.
Panel sort mode.

Panel title.
Panel type ID.
Panel view mode.
Values : AlternativeFull, Brief, Medium, Full, Wide, Detailed, Descriptions, LongDescriptions, FileOwners, FileLinks, Undefined
Any objects to be shown as panel files.
